title: Major Earthquake Strikes Pacific Rim
content:
A strong M6.3 earthquake struck near the coast of Hokkaido, Japan, on June 1, 2025, at 18:51 UTC. The shallow quake, also reported as M6.0 by USGS and EMSC, occurred at a depth of 31 km (19.2 miles). Japanese authorities forecast slight sea level changes. This event marks the second M6+ earthquake in the Hokkaido region since May 31, raising concerns about seismic activity in the Pacific Rim.

Learn more: https://watchers.news/2025/06/01/m6-3-earthquake-hokkaido-japan-slight-sea-level-changes-forecast/
